scigenex 1.3.0
  • Install
  • Guided tutorial
  • Cell clustering alternative

Best co-expressed genes from each gene cluster

Source: R/top_genes.R
top_genes.Rd

Extract the highly co-expressed genes of each gene cluster.

top_genes(object, top = 20, cluster = "all")

Arguments

object

A ClusterSet object.

top

A value for the number of the most similar genes in gene clusters.

cluster

A vector of gene cluster identity.

Value

Examples


m <- matrix(rnorm(80000), nc=20)
m[1:100,1:10] <- m[1:100,1:10] + 4
m[101:200,11:20] <- m[101:200,11:20] + 3
m[201:300,5:15] <- m[201:300,5:15] + -2

res <- DBFMCL(data=m,
              distance_method="pearson",
              av_dot_prod_min = 0,
              inflation = 1.2,
              k=25,
              fdr = 10)
#> |--  Row names not provided. Adding. 
#> |--  Colum names not provided. Adding. 
#> The following parameters will be used : 
#> 	Working directory:  /mnt/NAS7/Workspace/bavaisj/dbfmcl/scigenex/docs/reference 
#> 	Ouput directory:  /mnt/NAS7/Workspace/bavaisj/dbfmcl/scigenex/docs/reference 
#> 	Name:  X1tR0oi30C 
#> 	Distance method:  pearson 
#> 	Minimum average dot product for clusters:  0 
#> 	Minimum cluster size:  10 
#> 	Number of neighbors:  25 
#> 	FDR:  10 % 
#> 	Inflation: 1.2 
#> 	Visualize standard outputs from both mcl and cluster commands:  FALSE 
#> 
#> |--  DBF completed. Starting MCL step. 
#> Running mcl (graph partitioning)... 
#> |--  Done 
#> |--  creating file : /mnt/NAS7/Workspace/bavaisj/dbfmcl/scigenex/docs/reference/X1tR0oi30C.mcl_out.txt 
#> |--  Reading and filtering MCL output: /mnt/NAS7/Workspace/bavaisj/dbfmcl/scigenex/docs/reference/X1tR0oi30C.mcl_out.txt 
#> |--  3  clusters conserved after MCL partitioning. 
#> |--  0  clusters filtered out from MCL partitioning (size and mean dot product). 
              
res <- top_genes(object = res, top=500, cluster="all")
#> Warning: Number of top genes is greater than the number of genes in cluster 1. All genes will be use and order by similarity rank.
#> Warning: Number of top genes is greater than the number of genes in cluster 2. All genes will be use and order by similarity rank.
#> Warning: Number of top genes is greater than the number of genes in cluster 3. All genes will be use and order by similarity rank.
#> |--  Results are stored in top_genes slot of ClusterSet object. 
res@top_genes
